TD490-d-04-16-90-RFP.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 2:15AM ON APRIL 16, 1990, A COLLISION OCCURRED INVOLVING CARS BEING CLASSIFIED BY THE AR-12 ACCA YARD ASSIGNMENT. THE YARD ASSIGNMENT CLASSIFIED FOUR (4) CARS INTO THE NORTH END OF NO.12 TRACK, NORTH YARD, BUT FAILED TO APPLY A SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF HAND BRAKES TO HOLD THE CARS. THEFOUR (4) CARS ROLLED NORTH DOWN NO.12 TRACK AND STOPPED FOULING THE LADDER TRACK. THE YARD ASSIGNMENT NOT SEEING THE CARS FOULING THE LADDER TRACK CUT LOOSE CAR WCTR 100821 TO ROLL FREE TO CLASSIFICATION IN NO.19 TRACK. AS CAR WCTR 100821 WAS ROLLING SOUTH ON THE LADDER TRACK AND STARTED PAST THE NORTH END OF NO.12 TRACK, THE SOUTHWEST CORNER OF CAR WCTR 100821 STRUCK GATX 300741, WHICH WAS THE NORTHERN MOST CAR IN THE CUT OF FOUR CARS SETTING ON NO.12 TRACK FOULING THE LADDER TRACK. BOTH CARS RECEIVED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE IN THE COLLISION, BUT NEITHER DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
